_exec_summary.SummaryText:
ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION AND EMERGENCY RESPONSE POLICIES

The owners, management, and employees of Emmpak Foods are committed to the prevention of any accidental release of ammonia. The policy is to adhere to all applicable Federal and State rules and regulations in order to: 1) prevent unnecessary human exposure, 2) reduce the threat to employees' health, and 3) reduce the threat to nearby members of the community.

Safety depends upon the safety devices inherent in the design of the operation, the safe handling procedures used, the training of personnel, and the manner in which an accidental release is handled.

REGULATED SUBSTANCES

The facility processes beef for the food industry. There is one regulated process at the facility; the use of anhydrous ammonia for refrigeration. The process contains a total of 35,000 pounds of ammonia. There are two other anhydrous ammonia refrigeration systems at the facility not covered by RMP. One is the East Plant, an 8,000 pound system. The second is the West Plant, a 4,000 pound system.

ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION PROGRAM

The facility complies with OSHA's Process Safety Management and EPA's Accidental Release Rule and all applicable State codes and regulations.

Properly trained personnel conduct daily inspections and maintenance activities on the ammonia systems.

FIVE-YEAR ACCIDENT HISTORY

There have been no accidental releases of ammonia at the facility in the past five years.

EMERGENCY RESPONSE PLAN

The facility implements an Emergency Action Plan in accordance with 29 CFR 1910.38. Employees receive training on an annual basis. The facility will notify the fire department in the event of an emergency.

PLANNED CHANGES TO IMPROVE SAFETY

The facility believes that safety improvement is an on-going process at the facility. Improvements to the program will be made as the opportunity arises.
